title: Investigations into categorial grammar: Symmetric pregroup grammar and displacement calculus
excerpt: In this thesis we investigate a symmetric extension of pregroup grammars, and the generative capacity of the Displacement Calculus.
citation: Wijnholds, G. (2011). "Investigations into categorial grammar: Symmetric pregroup grammar and displacement calculus." BSc Thesis, Utrecht University.

title: Conversions between D and MCFG: Logical Characterizations of the Mildly Context-Sensitive Languages
venue: Computational Linguistics in the Netherlands Journal
excerpt: This paper describes a characterisation of well-nested Multiple Context Free Languages by first order Displacement Calculus.
citation: Wijnholds, G. J. (2014). "Conversions between D and MCFG: Logical Characterizations of the Mildly Context-Sensitive Languages." Computational Linguistics in the Netherlands Journal. 4.

title: Categorical Foundations for Extended Compositional Distributional Models of Meaning
excerpt: In the thesis we investigate a categorical compositional distributional model for the Lambek-Grishin Calculus, a two-sided extension of the Lambek Calculus. We also look at graphical languages for reasoning with diagrams for this extended model.
citation: Wijnholds, G. (2014). "Categorical Foundations for Extended Compositional Distributional Models of Meaning." MSc Thesis, Institute for Logic, Language, and Computation.

title: Syntactic control for compositional vector space models
venue: Topology, Algebra, and Categories in Logic 2015
excerpt: We discuss the use of the Lambek-Grishin Calculus in a compositional distributional model of meaning.
citation: Moortgat, M. J., and Wijnholds, G. "Syntactic control for compositional vector space models." Topology, Algebra, and Categories in Logic 2015 (2015): 204-206.

title: Vector Semantics for Lambek Calculus with Contraction
venue: Logic and Algorithms in Computational Linguistics 2017
excerpt: We discuss vector semantics for a relevant style of Lambek Calculus.
citation: Wijnholds, G, and Sadrzadeh, M. "Vector Semantics for Lambek Calculus with Contraction." Workshop on Logic and Algorithms in Computational Linguistics 2017 (LACompLing2017). 2017.

title: Coherent Diagrammatic Reasoning in Compositional Distributional Semantics
excerpt: In this paper we develop a graphical language for reasoning about information flow in the Lambek Calculus.
citation: Wijnholds, G. J. (2017). "Coherent Diagrammatic Reasoning in Compositional Distributional Semantics." WoLLIC 2017, Lecture Notes in Computer Science. 10388.

title: Lexical and Derivational Meaning in Vector-Based Models of Relativisation
excerpt: We give an account of pronoun relativisation in Dutch in a compositional distributional model.
citation: Moortgat, M. and Wijnholds, G. (2017). "Lexical and Derivational Meaning in Vector-Based Models of Relativisation." Proceedings of the 21st Amsterdam Colloquium.

title: A Proof-Theoretic Approach to Scope Ambiguity in Compositional Vector Space Models
excerpt: Journal of Language Modelling. We combine a proof-theoretic model of scope ambiguities with a lexical treatment of quantifiers in a compositional distributional model.
citation: Wijnholds, G. "A Proof-Theoretic Approach to Scope Ambiguity in Compositional Vector Space Models." Journal of Language Modelling, Vol 6, No 2.

title: Classical Copying versus Quantum Entanglement in Natural Language: The Case of VP-ellipsis
venue: Proceedings of the 2018 workshop on Compositional Approaches in Physics, NLP and Social Sciences
excerpt: We develop and compare two compositional distributional models for embedding VP-elliptical phrases.
citation: Wijnholds, G. and Sadrzadeh, M. (2018). "Classical Copying versus Quantum Entanglement in Natural Language: The Case of VP-ellipsis." CAPNS 2018 proceedings.

title: Evaluating Composition Models for Verb Phrase Elliptical Sentence Embeddings
excerpt: We evaluate compositional distributional models for VP-elliptical phrases.
citation: Wijnholds, G. and Sadrzadeh, M. (2019). "Evaluating Composition Models for Verb Phrase Elliptical Sentence Embeddings." NAACL-HLT 2019 (Long).

title: A Type-Driven Vector Semantics for Ellipsis with Anaphora using Lambek Calculus with Limited Contraction
excerpt: We develop a vector space semantics for verb phrase ellipsis with anaphora using type-driven compositional distributional semantics based on the Lambek calculus with limited contraction (LCC) of JÃ¤ger (2006).
citation: Wijnholds, G. and Sadrzadeh, M. (2019). "A Type-Driven Vector Semantics for Ellipsis with Anaphora using Lambek Calculus with Limited Contraction." Journal of Logic, Language and Information, 2019.

title: Incremental Semantic Judgments
excerpt: We discuss vector semantics for Dynamic Syntax and present empirical results on incremental disambiguation experiments.
citation: Purver, M, and Sadrzadeh, M, and Wijnholds, G, and Kempson, R, and Hough, J. "Incremental Semantic Judgments." Third Dynamic Syntax Conference. 2019.

title: Categorical Vector Space Semantics for Lambek Calculus with a Relevant Modality
excerpt: We develop a vector semantics based on the Lambek Calculus with a relevant modality, and give experimental result on a new dataset.
citation: McPheat, L. and Sadrzadeh, M. and Wazni, H. and Wijnholds, G. (2020). "Categorical Vector Space Semantics for Lambek Calculus with a Relevant Modality." ArXiV preprint.

title: A Frobenius Algebraic Analysis for Parasitic Gaps
excerpt: We develop a Frobenius Algebraic account for parasitic gapping.
citation: Moortgat, M., and Sadrzadeh, M. and Wijnholds, G. (2019). "A Frobenius Algebraic Analysis for Parasitic Gaps." IfCoLog Journal of Applied Logics.

title: A toy distributional model for fuzzy generalised quantifiers
excerpt: We develop a rudimentary experiment with fuzzy generalised quantifiers, following earlier work.
citation: Sadrzadeh, M. and Wijnholds, G. (2020). "A toy distributional model for fuzzy generalised quantifiers." Proceedings of the Probability and Meaning Conference (PaM).

title: A Compositional Vector Space Model of Ellipsis and Anaphora
excerpt: The results of a 3-year PhD at QMUL.
citation: Wijnholds, G. (2020). "A Compositional Vector Space Model of Ellipsis and Anaphora." PhD Dissertation, Queen Mary University of London.

title: Representation Learning for Type-Driven Composition
excerpt: We implement a tensor-based skipgram architecture to learn verb matrix representations. These outperform previous methods in tensor-based representation learning and approach state of the art deep neural network models on the SICK dataset.
citation: Wijnholds, G., and Sadrzadeh, M. and Clark, S. (2020). "Representation Learning for Type-Driven Composition." Proceedings of the 24th Conference on Computational Natural Language Learning.

title: Incremental Composition in Distributional Semantics
excerpt: We describe an incremental approach to tensor-based distributional semantics, following Dynamic Syntax. We experiment with an incremental disambiguation task.
citation: Purver, M. and Sadrzadeh, M. and Kempson, R. and Wijnholds, G. and Hough, J. (2021). "Incremental Composition in Distributional Semantics." Journal of Logic, Language and Information.

title: Fuzzy Generalised Quantifiers for Natural Language in Categorical Compositional Distributional Semantics
venue: Mathematics, Logic, and Their Philosophies: Essays in Honour of Mohammad Ardeshir, Logic, Epistemology, and the Unity of Science
excerpt: We develop the mathematics to deal with fuzzy generalized quantifiers in a compositional distributional model of meaning.
citation: Dostal, M. and Sadrzadeh, M. and Wijnholds, G. (2020). "Fuzzy Generalised Quantifiers for Natural Language in Categorical Compositional Distributional Semantics." Mathematics, Logic, and Their Philosophies: Essays in Honour of Mohammad Ardeshir, Logic, Epistemology, and the Unity of Science.

title: SICK-NL: A Dataset for Dutch Natural Language Inference
excerpt: We provide a semi-automatic translation of the SICK dataset into Dutch, providing the first Dutch Natural Language Inference task. Experiments suggest that the Dutch task is harder, and that state of the art language models do not fully capture syntactic invariance.
citation: Wijnholds, G. and Moortgat, M. (2021). "SICK-NL: A Dataset for Dutch Natural Language Inference." Proceedings of the 16th Conference of the European Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics.

title: Improving BERT Pretraining with Syntactic Supervision
excerpt: We train a BERT model from scratch for Dutch, while incorporating a supertagging objective to induce a syntactic bias. Initial experiments hint at improved or equal performance on a number of tasks, despite pretraining on a small amount of data.
citation: Tziafas, G. and Kogkalidis, K. and Wijnholds, G. and Moortgat, M. (2021). "Improving BERT Pretraining with Syntactic Supervision." ArXiV preprint.

title: Anaphora and Ellipsis in Lambek Calculus with a Relevant Modality: Syntax and Semantics
excerpt: We use a DisCoCat vector space instance of semantics and show how one can interpret anaphora, ellipsis, and for the first time derive the sloppy vs strict vector readings of ambiguous anaphora with ellipsis cases.
citation: McPheat, L. and and Wijnholds, G. and Sadrzadeh, M. and Correia, A. and Toumi, A. (2021). "Anaphora and Ellipsis in Lambek Calculus with a Relevant Modality: Syntax and Semantics." Journal of Cognitive Science.

title: Discontinuous Constituency and BERT: A Case Study of Dutch
excerpt: We devise a test suite based on a mildly context-sensitive formalism, from which we derive grammars that capture the linguistic phenomena of control verb nesting and verb raising. The grammars, paired with a small lexicon, provide us with a large collection of naturalistic utterances, annotated with verb-subject pairings, that serve as the evaluation test bed for an attention-based span selection probe. Our results, backed by extensive analysis, suggest that the models investigated fail in the implicit acquisition of the dependencies examined.
citation: Kogkalidis, K. and Wijnholds, G. (2022). "Discontinuous Constituency and BERT: A Case Study of Dutch." Findings of the Association for Computational Linguistics 2022.
